glsa.title: Courier-IMAP: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in Courier-IMAP allowing for remote code execution with root privileges.

background.p: Courier-IMAP is an IMAP server which is part of the Courier mail system. It provides access only to maildirs.

description.p: CJ Kucera has discovered that some Courier-IMAP scripts don't properly handle the XMAILDIR variable, allowing for shell command injection.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted login credentials to a Courier-IMAP server instance, possibly leading to remote code execution with root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
